alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 01 at 6:04PM MST until March 02 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THURSDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow above 4000 feet. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 10 inches. * WHERE...Areas above 4000 feet near Doney Park, Flagstaff, Grand Canyon, North Rim, Sedona, Valle and Williams. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening and morning commute. Additional snow forecast from 5 PM Today to 11 AM Thursday: Doney Park 4 to 8 inches Flagstaff 6 to 10 inches Grand Canyon 6 to 10 inches North Rim 7 to 11 inches Sedona 4 to 8 inches Valle 4 to 8 inches Williams 6 to 10 inches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim
